did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Pamphlets, flyers, syllabi, brochures, and ephemeral publications from Bayside, NY, Ithaca, NY, and nationally, ca. 1969-1978, on radical and anarchist feminism, women's sexuality and health, rape, women and work, spirituality and wicca, sex roles and racism in schools. Includes application form for creation of Women's Liberation at Queensborough Community College in Bayside, NY.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Founded a student organization, Women's Liberation, at Queensborough Community Collge in spring 1970 and served as first president. Librarian at Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, flyers, syllabi, brochures, and ephemeral publications from Bayside, NY, Ithaca, NY, and nationally, ca. 1969-1978, on radical and anarchist feminism, women's sexuality and health, rape, women and work, spirituality and wicca, sex roles and racism in schools. Includes application form for creation of Women's Liberation at Queensborough Community College in Bayside, NY.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Barbara Berger Eden papers, #7686. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
